name: @thej@social.thej.in
note: Hacker, Maker, Blogger, Developer, Teacher, Public Interest Technologist @DataMeet & CTO @Peppo. I blog at ThejeshGN.com and this is my social microblog. Everything is Personal. Bangalore/India. +05:30, IST. He/His. Email.

content.html:
I spent a good part of this year investigating Google's ad business. Today we published a story about trying to crack open its black box ad network.

Unlike its competitors, Google conceals nearly all publishers it works with and where billions of ad dollars flow. We found that Google's vast ad network contains manga piracy, porn, fraud and disinformation.

Give it a read: https://www.propublica.org/article/google-display-ads-piracy-porn-fraud
content.value: I spent a good part of this year investigating Google's ad business. Today we published a story about trying to crack open its black box ad network.Unlike its competitors, Google conceals nearly all publishers it works with and where billions of ad dollars flow. We found that Google's vast ad network contains manga piracy, porn, fraud and disinformation.Give it a read: https://www.propublica.org/article/google-display-ads-piracy-porn-fraud

content.html:
My Boring Yet Modern Data Stack

We have a data stack that we have been using for years now. We have used it with medium to large customers, and they have worked very well. The goal has always been simple, stable, composable tools that can be used on the developer's machine and scaled to work with massive data on production. You can self-host them, host them on the cloud, or get managed services based on your need.

Very similar to my web stack. It's called "Boring" not because it's dull but because there are minimal unwanted surprises. So my current stack for data looks like this. This stack is both "Modern" and "Boring."

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/22/my-boring-yet-modern-data-stack/

Missing

Currently, our documentation is basic and manual. I would want a sound metadata management and cataloging/discovery system—systems like OpenDataDiscovery or OpenMetaData. But everything seems complex. Essentially I want a Metabase equivalent for metadata management and data discovery. I am still evaluating. I will update you if I find a good candidate. Please send me your suggestions.
content.value:
My Boring Yet Modern Data Stack
We have a data stack that we have been using for years now. We have used it with medium to large customers, and they have worked very well. The goal has always been simple, stable, composable tools that can be used on the developer's machine and scaled to work with massive data on production. You can self-host them, host them on the cloud, or get managed services based on your need.
Very similar to my web stack. It's called "Boring" not because it's dull but because there are minimal unwanted surprises. So my current stack for data looks like this. This stack is both "Modern" and "Boring."
https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/22/my-boring-yet-modern-data-stack/
Missing
Currently, our documentation is basic and manual. I would want a sound metadata management and cataloging/discovery system—systems like OpenDataDiscovery or OpenMetaData. But everything seems complex. Essentially I want a Metabase equivalent for metadata management and data discovery. I am still evaluating. I will update you if I find a good candidate. Please send me your suggestions.

content.html:
“It was later revealed by India’s national auditor that, between 2006 and 2009, the Gujarat government sold natural gas to Adani at below-market rates. According to a 2013 report in the Economic Times, several senior Gujarat government officers had been given jobs at Adani following their retirement from public service.”

The rich always become richer with handouts. This is why they fight hard to prevent poor people from getting a handout.
content.value: “It was later revealed by India’s national auditor that, between 2006 and 2009, the Gujarat government sold natural gas to Adani at below-market rates. According to a 2013 report in the Economic Times, several senior Gujarat government officers had been given jobs at Adani following their retirement from public service.”The rich always become richer with handouts. This is why they fight hard to prevent poor people from getting a handout.

content.html:
ಡಿಸೆಂಬರ್ 21, ಕನ್ನಡದ ಪ್ರಮುಖ ಸಾಹಿತಿ, ಚಿಂತಕರಲ್ಲಿ ಒಬ್ಬರಾಗಿದ್ದ ಯು ಆರ್ ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ಜನ್ಮದಿನ. ಎಂತಹಾ ವೈರುಧ್ಯಗಳ ನಡುವೆಯೂ ಮುಖಾಮುಖಿ ಕುಳಿತು ಸಂವಾದಿಸಬಲ್ಲವರಾಗಿದ್ದ ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ಚಿಂತನೆಗಳು ಇಂದಿಗೂ, ಮುಂದಿಗೂ ಪ್ರಸ್ತುತ.

ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ನೆನಪಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಡಿಸೆಂಬರ್ 18ರಂದು ಆರ್.ವಿ. ಟೀಚರ್ಸ್ ಕಾಲೇಜಿನ ಸಭಾಂಗಣದಲ್ಲಿ ಆಯೋಜನೆಗೊಂಡಿದ್ದ ಉಪನ್ಯಾಸ ಕಾರ್ಯಕ್ರಮದಲ್ಲಿ ಶಿಕ್ಷಣ ತಜ್ಞ ಶ್ರೀ ಪ್ರತಾಪ್ ಭಾನು ಮೆಹ್ತಾ ಅವರು ಆಡಿದ ಮಾತುಗಳು ಇಲ್ಲಿವೆ.

https://youtu.be/VnxdLnjn9gc #uramemorial #uranantamurthy via @sanchispeak
content.value: ಡಿಸೆಂಬರ್ 21, ಕನ್ನಡದ ಪ್ರಮುಖ ಸಾಹಿತಿ, ಚಿಂತಕರಲ್ಲಿ ಒಬ್ಬರಾಗಿದ್ದ ಯು ಆರ್ ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ಜನ್ಮದಿನ. ಎಂತಹಾ ವೈರುಧ್ಯಗಳ ನಡುವೆಯೂ ಮುಖಾಮುಖಿ ಕುಳಿತು ಸಂವಾದಿಸಬಲ್ಲವರಾಗಿದ್ದ ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ಚಿಂತನೆಗಳು ಇಂದಿಗೂ, ಮುಂದಿಗೂ ಪ್ರಸ್ತುತ. ಅನಂತಮೂರ್ತಿಯವರ ನೆನಪಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಡಿಸೆಂಬರ್ 18ರಂದು  ಆರ್.ವಿ. ಟೀಚರ್ಸ್ ಕಾಲೇಜಿನ ಸಭಾಂಗಣದಲ್ಲಿ ಆಯೋಜನೆಗೊಂಡಿದ್ದ ಉಪನ್ಯಾಸ ಕಾರ್ಯಕ್ರಮದಲ್ಲಿ ಶಿಕ್ಷಣ ತಜ್ಞ ಶ್ರೀ ಪ್ರತಾಪ್ ಭಾನು ಮೆಹ್ತಾ ಅವರು ಆಡಿದ ಮಾತುಗಳು ಇಲ್ಲಿವೆ.https://youtu.be/VnxdLnjn9gc #uramemorial #uranantamurthy via @sanchispeak

content.html:
You might see fail whales on #fedi today. Have patience. It will improve.

Small improvements by crowd over time will make software better. Its been proven more than once. And probably it's the best way to develop social networking tools.
content.value:
You might see fail whales on #fedi today. Have patience. It will improve.
Small improvements by crowd over time will make software better. Its been proven more than once. And probably  it's the best way to develop social networking tools.

content.html: Today’s social media status quo isn’t cutting it, so Mozilla is exploring an alternative here on Mastodon. In early 2023, Mozilla will be testing a publicly accessible instance in the Fediverse at Mozilla.Social. We will keep you updated, but for now learn more here: https://mzl.la/3BNXQMQ
content.value: Today’s social media status quo isn’t cutting it, so Mozilla is exploring an alternative here on Mastodon. In early 2023, Mozilla will be testing a publicly accessible instance in the Fediverse at Mozilla.Social. We will keep you updated, but for now learn more here:  https://mzl.la/3BNXQMQ

content.html:
@mozilla Love this sentence in the last paragraph, sums up the problem statement well IMHO -

"In private hands our [social media] choice is limited, toxicity is rewarded, rage is called engagement, public trust is corroded, and basic human decency is often an afterthought."
content.value: @mozilla Love this sentence in the last paragraph, sums up the problem statement well IMHO -"In private hands our [social media] choice is limited, toxicity is rewarded, rage is called engagement, public trust is corroded, and basic human decency is often an afterthought."

content.html:
After a bit of experimentation and tinkering tonight, it appears that one can use their #WordPress website to create threaded conversations on #Mastodon (and likely other portions of the #Fediverse) using the IndieWeb syndication strategy of POSSE with backfeed of comments using #Webmention and Brid.gy. I’d outlined the process using Twitter in the past, and the same principles seem to work well for Mastodon. #IndieWeb #FTW #FediTips

#backfeed #brid-gy #feditips #fediverse #ftw #indieweb #mastodon #posse #threaded-replies #webmention #wordpress

https://boffosocko.com/2022/12/17/55812913/
content.value:

content.html: Want to work on Mastodon full time? I’d like to pay a Rails dev for the next 3+ months to implement some auth improvements that matter to me but also just burn down bugs, make perf improvements, whatever is needed as this place grows. Remote 100% ok but need 3-4 hrs of Pacific time zone overlap, fair pay, meaningful work. #fedihire #ruby #rails #job

Mastodon News Sources

General News - US and World

BBC News (World) Bot - @BBCWorld
BBC News Bot - @BBC
CNN Bot - @CNN
CNN Breaking News - @cnnbrk
DW (Deutsche Welle) News Bot - @dwnews_bot
NPR US News Bot - @NPR_USNews
NYTimes Bot - @NYTimes
Reuters Bot - @reuters
Rolling Stone - @RollingStone
The Guardian US Bot - @TheGuardian_us
Wall Street Journal Bot - @wsj
Washington Post Bot - @WashingtonPost

Tech News

Ars Technica - @arstechnica
MacRumors.com - @macrumors

content.html: I don't have the energy to argue with the people who tell me that by linking to ElonJet's Mastodon account, I am supporting stalking because I don't think they are arguing in good faith. They are weirdly unconcerned with stalking, harassment, or threats to people who don't own private jets, such as the gay former Twitter employee Elon falsely claimed supported pedophilia last week.
content.value: I don't have the energy to argue with the people who tell me that by linking to ElonJet's Mastodon account, I am supporting stalking because I don't think they are arguing in good faith. They are weirdly unconcerned with stalking, harassment, or threats to people who don't own private jets, such as the gay former Twitter employee Elon falsely claimed supported pedophilia last week.

content.html: If you cannot tell the difference between journalists using public data to hold the powerful accountable and law enforcement demanding people's private data because they think they might be bad guys, I don't know what to tell you. These are fundamentally different things.
content.value: If you cannot tell the difference between journalists using public data to hold the powerful accountable and law enforcement demanding people's private data because they think they might be bad guys, I don't know what to tell you. These are fundamentally different things.
